column4: Hi there! Using Karmic as Live CD, the monitor starts blinking at the login, but not into graphics mode, but in text mode
I have the same issue at two computers
Which graphics cards?
Hm, GeForce 6500 should work for all I know.
Is it the same monitor for both computers?
I hoped for an easy solution :-)
Have a look at /var/log/Xorg.0.log at the command line. The last lines should tell you what's going wrong with the graphic mode.
Oh, you do see the splash animation during the boot?
Ah, if you use the live system, everything is fine, but if you boot your installed system, the graphics mode won't come up?
OK. And you did install the proprietary Nvidia driver, right?
Let me guess, there was a kernel update before your problems?
OK, check with "lsmod" if the nvidia module is loaded.
If not, try to load it manually.
Via "modprobe nvidia".
with that computer, the only problem I have, and never did before It's the freeze
Hm? When does the computer freeze? I think it's blinking some times?
Sorry, I'm puzzeled now. What is your problem?
When exactly does the computer freeze? Is it reproducable?
let me see.
Still there?
Did you remember the last freeze, when it happended? Could you describe the circumstances a bit?
